article.headline: Dow jumps 175 points on gains in shares of IBM, Chevron
article.body: Shares of IBM and Chevron are trading higher Tuesday afternoon, lifting the Dow Jones Industrial Average into positive territory. Shares of IBM IBM, -2.81% and Chevron CVX, -1.62% have contributed to the index's intraday rally, as the Dow DJIA, +0.56% is trading 175 points, or 0.6%, higher. IBM's shares have climbed $2.71, or 2.2%, while those of Chevron are up $1.51, or 2.1%, combining for a roughly 28-point bump for the Dow. Also contributing significantly to the gain are Goldman Sachs GS, -0.21%, Cisco CSCO, +0.15%, and JPMorgan Chase JPM, -0.57%. A $1 move in any one of the 30 components of the benchmark equates to a 6.58-point swing. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
